instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Macbook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015. Board seems to be <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
It sees the battery and shows 3% but when I disconect the magsafe, it shutdown.
J7050 without ac adapter pin 1-9 at 0V
J7050 with ac adapter

pin1 - 12V and comes to 1V softly for 20 seg.
scl and sda - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> - 0V

Cannot fund where <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> goes and if this is the problem.

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Check for short to GND on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>. If that is OK then probably dead battery.

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: 2014 and 2015 battery are compatible? They seems the same on picture.

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="MDY, post: 18284"]2014 and 2015 battery are compatible? They seems the same on picture.[/QUOTE]

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Compare the Axxxx number. The must match.

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
2015 model is A1582
2014 model is A1493

So, they are compatible?

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: They are compatible, However i think the 2013/14 model is slightly less capacity or something. Anyhow what i can tell you is a 2015 board charges a 2013 battery just fine.

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Why take the chance? Some people say A1496 is compatible with A1405, I have seen enough issues with that. Order the right stuff.

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Just now is hard to get 2015 model and pretty easy to get 2014 model. And have 2 different MBP 2015. One charge the battery up to 1V and second one up to 2.9V
So should be battery...

threads.title: Not charging the battery <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
If it won't run off the battery but will run off the charger it detects the battery:

99% of the time, bad battery
1% of the time, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is present on charger, but not on battery, because resistor feeding <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to input of <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> regulator is blown.
